Home > external > kegg > getRxnsFromKEGG.m

getRxnsFromKEGG

PURPOSE

getRxnsFromKEGG

SYNOPSIS

function [model,isSpontaneous,isUndefinedStoich,isIncomplete,isGeneral]=getRxnsFromKEGG(keggPath)

DESCRIPTION 

 getRxnsFromKEGG
   Retrieves information on all reactions stored in KEGG database

   Input:
   keggPath            if keggRxns.mat is not in the RAVEN\external\kegg
                       directory, this function will attempt to read data
                       from a local FTP dump of the KEGG database.
                       keggPath is the path to the root of this database

   Output:
   model               a model structure generated from the database. The
                       following fields are filled
       id                  'KEGG'
       description         'Automatically generated from KEGG database'
       rxns                KEGG reaction ids
       rxnNames            Name for each reaction entry
       mets                KEGG compound ids. If the equations use
                           stoichiometry such as ID(n+1) then the whole
                           expression is saved as the id
       eccodes             Corresponding ec-number if available
       rxnMiriams          Contains reaction specific information such as
                           KO id and pathways that the reaction is
                           associated to
       S                   Stoichiometric matrix
       lb                  -1000 for all reactions
       ub                  1000 for all reactions
       rev                 1 for reversible and 0 for irreversible. For
                           reactions present in pathway maps the
                           reversibility is taken from there
       b                   0 for all metabolites
   isSpontaneous       a cell array with the reactions labelled as
                       "spontaneous"
   isUndefinedStoich    a cell array with the reactions labelled as with
                       undefined stoichiometry
   isIncomplete        a cell array with the reactions labelled as
                       "incomplete", "erroneous" or "unclear"
   isGeneral           a cell array with the reactions labelled as
                       "general reaction"

   NOTE: Reactions on the form A <=> A + B will not be loaded. If the file
   keggRxns.mat is in the RAVEN/external/kegg directory it will be loaded
   instead of parsing of the KEGG files. If it does not exist it will be
   saved after parsing of the KEGG files. In general, you should remove
   the keggRxns.mat file along with other KEGG mat files if you want to
   rebuild the model structure from a newer version of KEGG.

   Usage: [model,isSpontaneous,isUndefinedStoich,isIncomplete,...
    isGeneral]=getRxnsFromKEGG(keggPath)

   Simonas Marcisauskas, 2019-07-21


 NOTE: This is how one entry looks in the file

 ENTRY       R00010                      Reaction
 NAME        alpha,alpha-trehalose glucohydrolase
 DEFINITION  alpha,alpha-Trehalose + H2O <=> 2 D-Glucose
 EQUATION    C01083 + C00001 <=> 2 C00031
 REMARK      Same as: R06103
 RCLASS      RC00049  C00031_C01083
 ENZYME      3.2.1.28
 PATHWAY     rn00500  Starch and sucrose metabolism
             rn01100  Metabolic pathways
 ORTHOLOGY   K01194  alpha,alpha-trehalase [EC:3.2.1.28]
 DBLINKS     RHEA: 32678
 ///

 The file is not tab-delimited. Instead each label is 12 characters
 (except for '///')

CROSS-REFERENCE INFORMATION

This function calls:
This function is called by:
  • getModelFromKEGG getModelFromKEGG

SOURCE CODE 

0001 function [model,isSpontaneous,isUndefinedStoich,isIncomplete,...
0002     isGeneral]=getRxnsFromKEGG(keggPath)
0003 % getRxnsFromKEGG
0004 %   Retrieves information on all reactions stored in KEGG database
0005 %
0006 %   Input:
0007 %   keggPath            if keggRxns.mat is not in the RAVEN\external\kegg
0008 %                       directory, this function will attempt to read data
0009 %                       from a local FTP dump of the KEGG database.
0010 %                       keggPath is the path to the root of this database
0011 %
0012 %   Output:
0013 %   model               a model structure generated from the database. The
0014 %                       following fields are filled
0015 %       id                  'KEGG'
0016 %       description         'Automatically generated from KEGG database'
0017 %       rxns                KEGG reaction ids
0018 %       rxnNames            Name for each reaction entry
0019 %       mets                KEGG compound ids. If the equations use
0020 %                           stoichiometry such as ID(n+1) then the whole
0021 %                           expression is saved as the id
0022 %       eccodes             Corresponding ec-number if available
0023 %       rxnMiriams          Contains reaction specific information such as
0024 %                           KO id and pathways that the reaction is
0025 %                           associated to
0026 %       S                   Stoichiometric matrix
0027 %       lb                  -1000 for all reactions
0028 %       ub                  1000 for all reactions
0029 %       rev                 1 for reversible and 0 for irreversible. For
0030 %                           reactions present in pathway maps the
0031 %                           reversibility is taken from there
0032 %       b                   0 for all metabolites
0033 %   isSpontaneous       a cell array with the reactions labelled as
0034 %                       "spontaneous"
0035 %   isUndefinedStoich    a cell array with the reactions labelled as with
0036 %                       undefined stoichiometry
0037 %   isIncomplete        a cell array with the reactions labelled as
0038 %                       "incomplete", "erroneous" or "unclear"
0039 %   isGeneral           a cell array with the reactions labelled as
0040 %                       "general reaction"
0041 %
0042 %   NOTE: Reactions on the form A <=> A + B will not be loaded. If the file
0043 %   keggRxns.mat is in the RAVEN/external/kegg directory it will be loaded
0044 %   instead of parsing of the KEGG files. If it does not exist it will be
0045 %   saved after parsing of the KEGG files. In general, you should remove
0046 %   the keggRxns.mat file along with other KEGG mat files if you want to
0047 %   rebuild the model structure from a newer version of KEGG.
0048 %
0049 %   Usage: [model,isSpontaneous,isUndefinedStoich,isIncomplete,...
0050 %    isGeneral]=getRxnsFromKEGG(keggPath)
0051 %
0052 %   Simonas Marcisauskas, 2019-07-21
0053 %
0054 %
0055 % NOTE: This is how one entry looks in the file
0056 %
0057 % ENTRY       R00010                      Reaction
0058 % NAME        alpha,alpha-trehalose glucohydrolase
0059 % DEFINITION  alpha,alpha-Trehalose + H2O <=> 2 D-Glucose
0060 % EQUATION    C01083 + C00001 <=> 2 C00031
0061 % REMARK      Same as: R06103
0062 % RCLASS      RC00049  C00031_C01083
0063 % ENZYME      3.2.1.28
0064 % PATHWAY     rn00500  Starch and sucrose metabolism
0065 %             rn01100  Metabolic pathways
0066 % ORTHOLOGY   K01194  alpha,alpha-trehalase [EC:3.2.1.28]
0067 % DBLINKS     RHEA: 32678
0068 % ///
0069 %
0070 % The file is not tab-delimited. Instead each label is 12 characters
0071 % (except for '///')
0072 %
0073 
0074 if nargin<1
0075     keggPath='RAVEN/external/kegg';
0076 end
0077 
0078 %Check if the reactions have been parsed before and saved. If so, load the
0079 %model
0080 [ST, I]=dbstack('-completenames');
0081 ravenPath=fileparts(fileparts(fileparts(ST(I).file)));
0082 rxnsFile=fullfile(ravenPath,'external','kegg','keggRxns.mat');
0083 if exist(rxnsFile, 'file')
0084     fprintf(['Importing KEGG reactions from ' strrep(rxnsFile,'\','/') '... ']);
0085     load(rxnsFile);
0086 else
0087     fprintf(['NOTE: Cannot locate ' strrep(rxnsFile,'\','/') ', it will therefore be generated from the local KEGG database\n']);
0088     if ~exist(fullfile(keggPath,'reaction'),'file') || ~exist(fullfile(keggPath,'reaction.lst'),'file') || ~exist(fullfile(keggPath,'reaction_mapformula.lst'),'file')
0089         EM=fprintf(['The files ''reaction'', ''reaction.lst'' and ''reaction_mapformula.lst'' cannot be located at ' strrep(keggPath,'\','/') '/ and should be downloaded from the KEGG FTP\n']);
0090         dispEM(EM);
0091     else
0092         fprintf('Generating keggRxns.mat file... ');
0093         %Add new functionality in the order specified in models
0094         model.id='KEGG';
0095         model.description='Automatically generated from KEGG database';
0096         
0097         %Preallocate memory for 15000 reactions
0098         model.rxns=cell(15000,1);
0099         model.rxnNames=cell(15000,1);
0100         model.eccodes=cell(15000,1);
0101         model.subSystems=cell(15000,1);
0102         model.rxnMiriams=cell(15000,1);
0103         model.rxnNotes=cell(15000,1);
0104         equations=cell(15000,1);
0105         %Temporarily store the equations
0106         
0107         isSpontaneous=false(15000,1);
0108         isIncomplete=false(15000,1);
0109         isGeneral=false(15000,1);
0110 
0111         %First load information on reaction ID, reaction name, KO, pathway,
0112         %and ec-number
0113         fid = fopen(fullfile(keggPath,'reaction'), 'r');
0114         
0115         %Keep track of how many reactions have been added
0116         rxnCounter=0;
0117         
0118         %Loop through the file
0119         orthology=false;
0120         pathway=false;
0121         module=false;
0122         while 1
0123             %Get the next line
0124             tline = fgetl(fid);
0125             
0126             %Abort at end of file
0127             if ~ischar(tline)
0128                 break;
0129             end
0130             
0131             %Skip '///'
0132             if numel(tline)<12
0133                 continue;
0134             end
0135             
0136             %Check if it's a new reaction
0137             if strcmp(tline(1:12),'ENTRY       ')
0138                 rxnCounter=rxnCounter+1;
0139                 
0140                 %Add empty strings where there should be such
0141                 model.rxnNames{rxnCounter}='';
0142                 model.eccodes{rxnCounter}='';
0143                 model.subSystems{rxnCounter}='';
0144                 model.rxnNotes{rxnCounter}='';
0145                 equations{rxnCounter}='';
0146                 
0147                 %Add reaction ID (always 6 characters)
0148                 model.rxns{rxnCounter}=tline(13:18);
0149                 orthology=false;
0150                 pathway=false;
0151                 module=false;
0152                 
0153                 %Add KEGG reaction ID miriam
0154                 tempStruct=model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter};
0155                 tempStruct.name{1,1}='kegg.reaction';
0156                 tempStruct.value{1,1}=tline(13:18);
0157                 model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter}=tempStruct;
0158             end
0159             
0160             %Add name
0161             if strcmp(tline(1:12),'NAME        ')
0162                 model.rxnNames{rxnCounter}=tline(13:end);
0163             end
0164             
0165             %Add whether the comment includes "incomplete", "erroneous" or
0166             %"unclear"
0167             if strcmp(tline(1:12),'COMMENT     ')
0168                 %Read all text until '///', 'RPAIR', 'ENZYME', 'PATHWAY' or 'RCLASS'
0169                 commentText=tline(13:end);
0170                 while 1
0171                     tline = fgetl(fid);
0172                     if ~strcmp(tline(1:3),'///') && ~strcmp(tline(1:3),'RPA') && ~strcmp(tline(1:3),'ENZ') && ~strcmp(tline(1:3),'PAT') && ~strcmp(tline(1:3),'RCL')
0173                         commentText=[commentText ' ' strtrim(tline)];
0174                     else
0175                         break;
0176                     end
0177                 end
0178                 if any(regexpi(commentText,'SPONTANEOUS'))
0179                     %It should start this way
0180                     isSpontaneous(rxnCounter)=true;
0181                 end
0182                 if any(regexpi(commentText,'INCOMPLETE')) || any(regexpi(commentText,'ERRONEOUS')) || any(regexpi(commentText,'UNCLEAR'))
0183                     isIncomplete(rxnCounter)=true;
0184                 end
0185                 if any(regexpi(commentText,'GENERAL REACTION'))
0186                     %It should start this way
0187                     isGeneral(rxnCounter)=true;
0188                 end
0189                 
0190                 %Go to next iteration if it is '///'
0191                 if numel(tline)<12
0192                     continue;
0193                 end
0194             end
0195             
0196             %Add ec-number
0197             if strcmp(tline(1:12),'ENZYME      ')
0198                 model.eccodes{rxnCounter}=tline(13:end);
0199                 model.eccodes{rxnCounter}=deblank(model.eccodes{rxnCounter});
0200                 model.eccodes{rxnCounter}=strcat('ec-code/',model.eccodes{rxnCounter});
0201                 model.eccodes{rxnCounter}=regexprep(model.eccodes{rxnCounter},'\s+',';ec-code/');
0202             end
0203             if numel(tline)>8
0204                 if strcmp(tline(1:9),'REFERENCE')
0205                     pathway=false;
0206                     orthology=false;
0207                 end
0208             end
0209             
0210             %Add module ids
0211             if numel(tline)>18
0212                 if strcmp(tline(1:12),'MODULE      ') || module==true
0213                     pathway=false;
0214                     orthology=false;
0215                     if isstruct(model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter})
0216                         addToIndex=numel(model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter}.name)+1;
0217                     else
0218                         addToIndex=1;
0219                     end
0220                     tempStruct=model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter};
0221                     tempStruct.name{addToIndex,1}='kegg.module';
0222                     tempStruct.value{addToIndex,1}=tline(13:18);
0223                     model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter}=tempStruct;
0224                 end
0225             end
0226             
0227             %Add RHEA id
0228             if numel(tline)>18
0229                 if strcmp(tline(1:18),'DBLINKS     RHEA: ')
0230                     pathway=false;
0231                     orthology=false;
0232                     module=false;
0233                     if isstruct(model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter})
0234                         addToIndex=numel(model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter}.name)+1;
0235                     else
0236                         addToIndex=1;
0237                     end
0238                     tempStruct=model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter};
0239                     tempStruct.name{addToIndex,1}='rhea';
0240                     tempStruct.value{addToIndex,1}=tline(19:end);
0241                     model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter}=tempStruct;
0242                 end
0243             end
0244             
0245             %Add KO-ids
0246             if numel(tline)>16
0247                 if strcmp(tline(1:16),'ORTHOLOGY   KO: ') || strcmp(tline(1:16),'            KO: ') || strcmp(tline(1:12),'ORTHOLOGY   ') || orthology==true
0248                     pathway=false;
0249                     module=false;
0250                     %Check if KO has been added already (each reaction may
0251                     %belong to several)
0252                     if isstruct(model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter})
0253                         addToIndex=numel(model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter}.name)+1;
0254                     else
0255                         addToIndex=1;
0256                     end
0257                     
0258                     tempStruct=model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter};
0259                     tempStruct.name{addToIndex,1}='kegg.orthology';
0260                     if strcmp(tline(13:16),'KO:')
0261                         %This is in the old version
0262                         tempStruct.value{addToIndex,1}=tline(17:22);
0263                     else
0264                         %This means that it found one KO in the new format
0265                         %and that subsequent lines might be other KOs
0266                         orthology=true;
0267                         tempStruct.value{addToIndex,1}=tline(13:18);
0268                     end
0269                     model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter}=tempStruct;
0270                 end
0271             end
0272             
0273             %Add pathways
0274             if numel(tline)>18
0275                 if strcmp(tline(1:18),'PATHWAY     PATH: ') || strcmp(tline(1:18),'            PATH: ') || strcmp(tline(1:12),'PATHWAY     ') || pathway==true
0276                     orthology=false;
0277                     module=false;
0278                     %Check if annotation has been added already
0279                     if isstruct(model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter})
0280                         addToIndex=numel(model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter}.name)+1;
0281                     else
0282                         addToIndex=1;
0283                     end
0284                     
0285                     tempStruct=model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter};
0286                     tempStruct.name{addToIndex,1}='kegg.pathway';
0287                     %If it is the old version
0288                     if strcmp(tline(14:17),'PATH:')
0289                         tempStruct.value{addToIndex,1}=tline(19:25);
0290                     else
0291                         %If it is the new version
0292                         tempStruct.value{addToIndex,1}=tline(13:19);
0293                         pathway=true;
0294                     end
0295                     
0296                     %Do not save global or overview pathways. The ids for
0297                     %such pathways begin with rn011 or rn012
0298                     if ~strcmp('rn011',tempStruct.value{addToIndex,1}(1:5)) && ~strcmp('rn012',tempStruct.value{addToIndex,1}(1:5))
0299                         model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter}=tempStruct;
0300                         
0301                         %Also save the subSystems names. For the old KEGG
0302                         %format, only the first mentioned subsystem is
0303                         %picked. Use the newer KEGG format to fetch all the
0304                         %subsystems
0305                         if strcmp(tline(14:17),'PATH:')
0306                             %The old format
0307                             model.subSystems{rxnCounter}=tline(28:end);
0308                         else
0309                             %The new format
0310                             model.subSystems{rxnCounter,1}{1,numel(model.subSystems{rxnCounter,1})+1}=tline(22:end);
0311                         end
0312                     end
0313                 end
0314             end
0315         end
0316         
0317         %Close the file
0318         fclose(fid);
0319         
0320         %This is done here since the the indexes won't match since some
0321         %reactions are removed along the way
0322         isIncomplete=model.rxns(isIncomplete);
0323         isGeneral=model.rxns(isGeneral);
0324         isSpontaneous=model.rxns(isSpontaneous);
0325 
0326         %If too much space was allocated, shrink the model
0327         model.rxns=model.rxns(1:rxnCounter);
0328         model.rxnNames=model.rxnNames(1:rxnCounter);
0329         model.eccodes=model.eccodes(1:rxnCounter);
0330         equations=equations(1:rxnCounter);
0331         model.rxnMiriams=model.rxnMiriams(1:rxnCounter);
0332         model.rxnNotes=model.rxnNotes(1:rxnCounter);
0333         model.subSystems=model.subSystems(1:rxnCounter);
0334         
0335         %Then load the equations from another file. This is because the
0336         %equations are easier to retrieve from there
0337         
0338         %The format is rxnID: equation The reactions should have been
0339         %loaded in the exact same order
0340         fid = fopen(fullfile(keggPath,'reaction.lst'), 'r');
0341         
0342         %Loop through the file
0343         for i=1:rxnCounter
0344             %Get the next line
0345             tline = fgetl(fid);
0346             
0347             equations{i}=tline(9:end);
0348         end
0349         
0350         %Close the file
0351         fclose(fid);
0352         
0353         %Several equations may have two whitespaces between the last
0354         %reactant and the reversible arrow sign. The number of whitespaces
0355         %is thus reduced to one
0356         equations = regexprep(equations,'  <=>', ' <=>');
0357         
0358         %Construct the S matrix and list of metabolites
0359         [S, mets, badRxns]=constructS(equations);
0360         model.S=S;
0361         model.mets=mets;
0362         
0363         %There is some limited evidence for directionality in
0364         %reaction_mapformula.lst. The information there concerns how the
0365         %reactions are drawn in the KEGG maps. If a reaction is
0366         %irreversible in the same direction for all maps, then I consider
0367         %is irreversible, otherwise reversible. Also, not all reactions are
0368         %present in the maps, so not all will have directionality. They
0369         %will be considered to be reversible
0370         
0371         %The format is R00005: 00330: C01010 => C00011 Generate a
0372         %reversibility structure with the fields: *rxns: reaction ids
0373         %*product: one met id that is a product. This is because the
0374         %*reactions might be written in another direction compared to in
0375         % the reactions.lst file
0376         %*rev: 1 if reversible, otherwise 0
0377         reversibility.rxns={};
0378         reversibility.product={};
0379         reversibility.rev=[];
0380         
0381         fid = fopen(fullfile(keggPath,'reaction_mapformula.lst'), 'r');
0382         while 1
0383             %Get the next line
0384             tline = fgetl(fid);
0385             
0386             %Abort at end of file
0387             if ~ischar(tline)
0388                 break;
0389             end
0390             
0391             rxn=tline(1:6);
0392             prod=tline(end-5:end);
0393             rev=any(strfind(tline,'<=>'));
0394             if isempty(reversibility.rxns)
0395                 reversibility.rxns{1}=rxn;
0396                 reversibility.product{1}=prod;
0397                 reversibility.rev(1)=rev;
0398             elseif strcmp(reversibility.rxns(end),rxn)
0399                 %Check if the reaction was added before. It's an ordered
0400                 %list, so only check the last element If it's reversible in
0401                 %the new reaction or reversible in the old reaction then
0402                 %set (keep) to be reversible
0403                 if rev==1 || reversibility.rev(end)==1
0404                     reversibility.rev(end)=1;
0405                 else
0406                     %This means that the reaction was already loaded, that
0407                     %it was irreversible before and irreversible in the new
0408                     %reaction. However, it could be that they are written
0409                     %in diferent directions. If the product differ, then
0410                     %set to be reversible. This assumes that the reactions
0411                     %are written with the same metabolite as the last one
0412                     %if they are in the same direction
0413                     if ~strcmp(prod,reversibility.product(end))
0414                         reversibility.rev(end)=1;
0415                     end
0416                 end
0417             else
0418                 reversibility.rxns=[reversibility.rxns;rxn];
0419                 reversibility.product=[reversibility.product;prod];
0420                 reversibility.rev=[reversibility.rev;rev];
0421             end
0422         end
0423         fclose(fid);
0424         
0425         %Update the reversibility
0426         model.rev=ones(rxnCounter,1);
0427         %Match the reaction ids
0428         irrevIDs=find(reversibility.rev==0);
0429         [~, I]=ismember(reversibility.rxns(irrevIDs),model.rxns);
0430         [~, prodMetIDs]=ismember(reversibility.product(irrevIDs),model.mets);
0431         model.rev(I)=0;
0432         
0433         %See if the reactions are written in the same order in model.S
0434         linearInd=sub2ind(size(model.S), prodMetIDs, I);
0435         changeOrder=I(model.S(linearInd)<0);
0436         %Change the order of these reactions
0437         model.S(:,changeOrder)=model.S(:,changeOrder).*-1;
0438         
0439         %Add some stuff to get a correct model structure
0440         model.ub=ones(rxnCounter,1)*1000;
0441         model.lb=model.rev*-1000;
0442         model.c=zeros(rxnCounter,1);
0443         model.b=zeros(numel(model.mets),1);
0444         model=removeReactions(model,badRxns,true,true);
0445         
0446         %Identify reactions with undefined stoichiometry. Such
0447         %reactions involve metabolites with an ID containing the letter "n"
0448         %or "m"
0449         I=cellfun(@any,strfind(model.mets,'n')) | cellfun(@any,strfind(model.mets,'m'));
0450         [~, J]=find(model.S(I,:));
0451         isUndefinedStoich=model.rxns(unique(J));   
0452         %Sort model that metabolites with undefined stoichiometry would
0453         %appear in the end of metabolites list
0454         metList=[model.mets(~I);model.mets(I)];
0455         [~,metIndexes]=ismember(metList,model.mets);
0456         model=permuteModel(model,metIndexes,'mets');
0457         
0458         %Sort model that i) spontaneous, ii) with undefined
0459         %stoichiometry, iii) incomplete and iv) general reactions would bve
0460         %ranked in the end of the model
0461         endRxnList=unique([model.rxns(ismember(model.rxns,isSpontaneous));model.rxns(ismember(model.rxns,isUndefinedStoich));model.rxns(ismember(model.rxns,isIncomplete));model.rxns(ismember(model.rxns,isGeneral))],'stable');
0462         rxnList=[model.rxns(~ismember(model.rxns,endRxnList));endRxnList];
0463         [~,rxnIndexes]=ismember(rxnList,model.rxns);
0464         model=permuteModel(model,rxnIndexes,'rxns');
0465         
0466         %Add information in rxnNotes, whether reaction belongs to any of
0467         %type i-iv mentioned a few lines above
0468         for i=(numel(rxnList)-numel(endRxnList)+1):numel(model.rxns)
0469             if ismember(model.rxns(i),isSpontaneous)
0470                 model.rxnNotes(i)=strcat(model.rxnNotes(i),'Spontaneous');
0471             end
0472             if ismember(model.rxns(i),isUndefinedStoich)
0473                 if isempty(model.rxnNotes{i})
0474                     model.rxnNotes(i)=strcat(model.rxnNotes(i),'With undefined stoichiometry');
0475                 else
0476                     model.rxnNotes(i)=strcat(model.rxnNotes(i),', with undefined stoichiometry');
0477                 end
0478             end
0479             if ismember(model.rxns(i),isIncomplete)
0480                 if isempty(model.rxnNotes{i})
0481                     model.rxnNotes(i)=strcat(model.rxnNotes(i),'Incomplete');
0482                 else
0483                     model.rxnNotes(i)=strcat(model.rxnNotes(i),', incomplete');
0484                 end
0485             end
0486             if ismember(model.rxns(i),isGeneral)
0487                 if isempty(model.rxnNotes{i})
0488                     model.rxnNotes(i)=strcat(model.rxnNotes(i),'General');
0489                 else
0490                     model.rxnNotes(i)=strcat(model.rxnNotes(i),', general');
0491                 end
0492             end
0493             model.rxnNotes(i)=strcat(model.rxnNotes(i),' reaction');
0494         end
0495         
0496         %Save the model structure
0497         save(rxnsFile,'model','isGeneral','isIncomplete','isUndefinedStoich','isSpontaneous');
0498     end
0499 end
0500 fprintf('COMPLETE\n');
0501 
0502 end
